intro: Asclepias kuntzei, commonly known as the Kuntze's milkweed, is a species native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae, characterized by its showy, pink to reddish-orange flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which deter herbivores. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open plains. Asclepias kuntzei is an important host plant for the monarch butterfly, supporting the life cycle of this iconic species.
